name: The Milling Room
address: 446 Columbus Ave, New York, NY 10024, USA

reviews.text: I had the most perfect time here, the venue is beautiful. I didn't know restaurants could be this good. The meal created a positive impression. Employees' service: first-rate. Mindful and polished. I suggest this place without hesitation.

Something has gone wrong with this place. We went for dinner yesterday after a long time, and something is off.

There was no host at the host station on the door, the dining room was almost empty yet service was really slow, the menu is now very limited, and yet when we ordered an appetizer of that list, we were told it was not available. And the food was not prepared well at all (excessive oil and salt).

A shame because we really used to like this place.
Poor hosting, late food, host lied about a reason. Slow timing.
Excellent ribeye.  Casual and comfortable dining experience.  Attentive service from Caesar
Go there for the experience and presentation, flavors are mid
Service and general atmosphere was great! Food was good but we did not think it was good enough to make us go back for another visit.

Busy restaurant but still somehow felt intimate. Meals were hearty and moscato hit the spot. Service was really attentive and friendly without being too much. A solid experience for a special occasion.
Service limitations. Recurrent attempts to whisk plates away during meals.
Just straight up rude and miserable staff.

We were a group of four for an early dinner on Thursday. The restaurant was mostly empty, yet the service was surprisingly slow. We ordered a bottle of white wine, but they almost served us a cheaper wine instead because they were low on inventory. When we asked for bread, we were told they donâ€™t serve any. The menu itself was very limited and quite different from the one shown online, which advertised many more appealing choices. Overall, it was a disappointing experience.
I like the salmon tartar and apple pie. A little cold

The Milling Room perfectly captures the essence of the Upper West Side, offering incredible food and even better drinks. The seasonal menu never disappoints, and while Iâ€™m not usually a dessert person, they absolutely nail it here! The bar is fantastic for a pre-dinner drink, and the main dining area is simply unmatched.
Posto carino, freddissimo per la troppa aria condizionata, cibo buono ma menu molto limitato, prezzi alti ma lo sapevamo
Excellent fine dining experience
Appears to be open and taking reservations but itâ€™s actually closed

One of those places where the level of quality extends from the decor to the food. Went here with a large group and the service was prompt with the dishes being served to the right guest without the usual â€œfood auctionâ€ that sometimes accompanies serving a large group. The food might not be as creative as other places but they execute the dishes exceptionally well.

I made a reservation a month in advance for July 13th to have lunch with my family, and it was suddenly cancelled the day before â€” with no explanation or justification.
This is completely unacceptable, and Iâ€™m extremely upset by the lack of professionalism and respect.
Yummy taste and beautiful place ğŸ˜

There was no working AC for a company event. They were slightly understaffed. Iâ€™m glad the friends that were there are so awesome because it would otherwise not been as bearable. The drinks are good and the beer on tap is cold. They just need to work and keeping the place cold and better staffed. (More not better. The staff there are very nice)

- ì•„ì´ê°€ ì˜¤ë Œì§€ ì£¼ìŠ¤ì»µì„ ì‹¤ìˆ˜ë¡œ ê¹¨ëœ¨ë ¸ìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤. ë¯¼ë§í•˜ì§€ ì•Šê²Œ ê´œì°®ë‹¤ë©° ì¹˜ì›Œì£¼ì…¨ìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤(ê³ ë§ˆì›Œìš”)
Sat at the bar.  Nice bartenders that gave me lots of advice about the city and great places to eat.  Happy Hour deals are pretty good.

The moscato wine is a great accompaniment to the crab cake; the flavor bursts on your palate in waves, and the setting is cozy.
The service is highly attentive.
Took a reservation for Fatherâ€™s Day and when we arrived they were closed. No explanation!
I love this place. Had become the after work chill spot for some of my coworkers and I. The bartenders are very nice and always make sure we are taken care of

We were presented with a very limited menu with only 3 main dishes. Nothing special. The prices were not justifiable to the dishes served.
The minute we walked in, the staff announced that there are no more pizzas (which were the cheapest in the menu, $26), the mango sorbet served for dessert was a puny one. By 9:10pm, the staff switched on bright lights to basically tell all patrons that theyâ€™re already closing.  The atmosphere was like eerie because there were only around 4 tables occupied at 8pm & the place was huge. There was nobody at the bar by 9pm & itâ€™s a Thursday night. I am not recommending this restaurant at all.

From what I understand, theyâ€™re going to start a remodel on the interior of this restaurant and in the meantime, they have a pizza baked at the curb outside by some fantastic chef, but when we got there at 8:45 the pizza was off the menu as they ran out! That left us very few choices for us to eat. we had hibachi which was very good And peas on straciatella. They didnâ€™t even have bread! the bread that they did end up bringing us after we complained a few times was hard as a rock. I hope the remodel goes well. I donâ€™t wanna dash this business to bits, but you should not go there until theyâ€™re done remodeling mid July.  We left very hungry.
Restaurante incrÃ­vel. ConfortÃ¡vel, aconchegante, excelente comida e serviÃ§o.

Our first visit two months ago was delightful. Good menu, good food, great atmosphere. Our visit this evening was the complete opposite. Minimal menu, high prices, and pizza being made in a truck on the street outside the restaurant. And WAY overpriced. Ridiculous.

The Milling Room is good, the decor is interesting enough, the staff attentive and the food well presented and cooked. It's sort of a "hearty meal" in that there's plenty on your plate and lots of meat. It's actually a very good restaurant and if you are nearby it's a worthwhile choice... In general the meat seemed more compelling than the salmon which is what I had.. In general though it wasn't very differentiated or creative...

The atmosphere is intimate, highly recommend pairing the crab cake with the moscato wine; the flavour hits you in the palate in waves!
Service is very attentive.
Lovely dining room that has upped its food game
Overpriced but great setting close to the park with a chill vibe.

If I could give no stars I would. This was the worst service I have received in my life. DO NOT GO HERE!!!!!! On top of how slow everything was, the food is mid and over priced. And then ! The charged another tables to our tab and couldnâ€™t fix it for an hour?
Had a great experience here last night.  Everything was good, but I want to make special mention of our server Maria Laura who was absolutely delightful.
Minuscule overpriced portions, inadequate wine list, big disappointment!

Beautiful space, great food, excellent service.  Tucked away from the hustle and bustle of the street, a large skylight takes advantage of the dining room's high ceilings and bathes the space in glorious indirect lighting.  Solid brunch offerings, great wine list.

Beautiful place.
Service was good although we asked for well
Done eggs for the elderly lady ( we were a party of 5) and we got running eggs , to get back what we waited 15 minutes and more â€¦
Food mediocre and quite pricey .

We went there today . The prices do not match up with the food quality and service .  My friends French Toast was burnt and we had to send it back only to have them charge us twice .  The waitress was very awkward and slow .The manager wouldnâ€™t even speak to us ( intentionally) One mimosa only and the bill was steep. Food was meh .     Will not be going back .
I loved the classic, romantic atmosphere and the food was delicious!!

Came here for brunch this past Sunday. I wasn't sure how this would be as the reviews were mixed. In the end we decided to chance it as it was close to the Nat History Museum... Our waitress was nice and had a genuine attitude of wanting customers to have a positive dining experience... We ordered a starter that never came, and then when our main dishes arrived she apologized and was honest that it was her mistake, and she quickly plugged in the app and let us know when it did arrive it was on the house... The space is big and bright during the day,  and the ceilings do create a lot of sound bouncing about the space, but  big spaces with high ceilings can create a lot of sound amplification so keep that in mind if you are looking for a quiet dining experience... The cocktail I had was well made... The brunch food was only meh at best. The omelet I had was fine, but unmemorable. The small salad that accompanied the dish was bland. My friend complained that her burger was awful. I tried her burger and I think my friend was being overly critical about the burger being awful, but fair to say it was bland... The tarte flambee appetizer that came at the end, which agin was free , we only ate a little of because it was not enjoyable. Trader Joe's sells something similar in a box that you throw in the oven that sadly tastes far better than what we received at our table.... I let the waitress know that in a past life I worked in high end food in NYC and that the kitchen needed to tighten things up, because a restaurant cannot achieve lasting longevity and return customers on mediocre food.
They have great pesto pasta and grilled octopus with smashed potatoes. It was great. I love the decoration of the restaurant itâ€™s so elegant.

Venimos aquÃ­ en parejas sin saber del Happy hour. Los cÃ³cteles estÃ¡n preparado a la mÃ¡xima rapidez, a veces lo que necesitan ser mezclado algunos segundos, lo sirven directamente y estÃ¡n demasiados fuerte. Tuvimos un despido muy frÃ­o y casi sin saludar, seguramente no es el mejor para probar cÃ³cteles en NY.
Nice place but so so and expensive food
Never ever going this place again with bad service + food quality

Nice room. Polite but amateurish and non responsive service that put a damper on the evening. Appple tart dessert brought to the table with ice cream followed  a few minutes later by side plates and silverware no acknowledgment of faux pas. Fun watching the ice cream melt Frankly everything was theater district i.e overpriced for the UWS

Nice spot. Spacious venue. Modern Industrial style. New American food, very taste. Wine list - good selections. Great and thoughtful service. Bar in the front in a different area. Great for big party dinner/lunch.
Haven't been in a while and loved it. A pretty place in an historical building with wonderful food and service.
Went there on my birthday with 3 friends . Everything was super great. Our server was a very tall guy either long hair . Polite and helpful.

Customer service is awful. Find another restaurant! Iâ€™m beyond disappointed with the customer service at The Milling Room. I made a reservation for Christmas Day weeks ago, confirmed it earlier that day, and then at 6:15pm on Christmas Eve, I received a text canceling my reservation because the restaurant isnâ€™t open on Christmas. A text - no phone call, no decency, just a cold, impersonal message less than 24 hours before our planned dinner.

When I called to speak to a manager, the hostess was incredibly rude, repeatedly denying my request to speak to anyone in charge and passing me around. After calling back, I was finally connected to a manager named David, who claimed he was â€œcaught off guard,â€ didnâ€™t know anything about the situation, and promised to call me back in 20 minutes. He never did.

To make matters worse, they blamed Resy, but Resy confirmed in an email that restaurants control their own availability. This mistake is 100% on The Milling Room. And letâ€™s not forget, they charge $35 per person if I cancel within 24 hours, but they can cancel on me at the last minute via text, ruin holiday plans, and offer zero accountability?

This level of unprofessionalism, especially at Christmas, is appalling. The Milling Room tries to present itself as a high-end restaurant, but this experience clearly demonstrates otherwise. Theyâ€™ve completely lost my trust and my business.

The milling room had an un-announced prix fixe menu. It should clearly state that on the reservation when you make it on open table and it shouldnâ€™t be expected to have to go to their website to know that

Normally food is certainly the first and biggest factor when I determine liked ones vs not, but this place is probably one of exceptional ones where my positive impression was primarily dictated by the layout of the space. It has cute little bar right next to the entrance and there is a semi-dark hallway that leads to main space which is pleasantly spacious and equipped with half-clear high-ceiling. I got significant impression as if Iâ€™m guided to open space and I think this is probably what makes experience from this restaurant the most unique one. It was very nice.

I enjoyed my foods too and would have certainly not 5 stared the place if food experience was anything negative. First time trying gnocchi and the texture was such a new experience to me. Overall it gave me impression that foods here are high quality and I would love to try their other menu sometime, although not again the same combination of the 2 menus I already tried cause both are somewhat on the greesy side so not a good pair to each other.

ì…êµ¬ì—ëŠ” ê·€ì—¬ìš´ ë°”ê°€ ì°°ì‹¹ ë¶™ì–´ìˆê³  ê·¸ ì•ìœ¼ë¡œëŠ” ì¡°ê¸ˆ ì–´ë‘‘ì–´ë‘‘í•œ í†µë¡œê°€ ë‚˜ìˆëŠ”ë°, ê·¸ê³³ì„ ì§€ë‚˜ë©´ ë°˜íˆ¬ëª…ì˜ ë†’ì€ ì²œì¥ì´ ë§ì´í•´ì£¼ëŠ” ë ˆìŠ¤í† ë‘ ë©”ì¸ ê³µê°„ì´ ë‚˜ì˜µë‹ˆë‹¤. ê·¸ ì—´ë ¤ìˆëŠ” ê³µê°„ìœ¼ë¡œ ë‚˜ê°€ëŠ” ë“¯í•œ ì „ì²´ì ì¸ ë ˆì´ì•„ì›ƒì´ êµ‰ì¥íˆ ì¸ìƒì ì´ì—ˆê³  ë„ˆë¬´ ê·¼ì‚¬í•˜ë‹¤ëŠ” ìƒê°ì´ ë“¤ì—ˆì–´ìš”. ë‚ ì”¨ ì¢‹ì€ ì–´ëŠë‚ ì— ë¸ŒëŸ°ì¹˜ë¡œ ì™€ë„ ì •ë§ ì¢‹ì„ ê²ƒ ê°™ì•„ìš”.
ë‚®ì—ëŠ” íœ´ì‹ ê³µê°„ìœ¼ë¡œë„ ë§ì€ ì‚¬ëŒë“¤ì´ ì°¾ëŠ” ê³³.

I found The Milling Room as i was searching for somewhere to carry my wife for her birthday. Usually, when I give a review, I speak firstly about the sights and the sound, but this time, I need to mention the chef.  I had the steak. It impacted every one of my senses. The aroma is intoxicating, and it tastes superb. All in all, it's one of the best, if not the best, steak I have ever had.  Complimented by romantic setting and the professional staff. You made our visit an experience. Thank you

If you want to experience a 5 Star Restaurant in France ğŸ‡«ğŸ‡· go to the Milling room on the upper West Side , A1 Service by Moussa & Staff. What a wonderful dinner I had with my family. The service was impeccable. Our server was so knowledgeable about the menu and took his time to explain each dish that we were curious about. The staff is excellent! Moussa the manager made sure we were well taken care of and came to our table multiple times to ask us if we needed anything else. The cocktails and food were absolutely delicious! The Chef Florian Hugo did an amazing job bringing wonderful fall flavors to the new menu. I highly recommend the Besos Caliente cocktail, the Tomato Feuillete appetizer, the prime striploin steak and the bourbon apple tart for dessert! If youâ€™re looking for delicious French fine dining the Milling room will exceed your expectations! Absolutely fantastic 5 stars!

Ambiance and service were great. I was here for brunch at 11:30am and it was very sleepy, which is great for conversation. The food and cocktails were OK/good, nothing special, but it was also reasonably priced so would return.

Milling room is a very underrated gem tucked away in UWS, right across from the museum. I've gone for both happy hour (every day from 4:30-6:30pm) and dinner: both are excellent. Happy hour is in the front at the bar, the menu is solid and the bartenders are always on their A game. Dinner is in their majestic, large dining room in the back and is one of the most visually appealing places to dine in the city (in my humble opinion).

For happy hour, get yourself a $10 cocktail and pair it with their burger and fries combo. The cocktail is super high quality and a great deal considering that an equivalent elsewhere runs for $15 or higher. The burger is up there with the greats. Will def back back here many more times.
The food and cocktail were delicious.   Our waitress was ok, we weren't deeling her energy.  She barely came to check on us.  However, he enjoyed the other service team.

I really enjoyed the Milling Room. The atmosphere is quite beautiful and calming. The service was attentive and polite. The food- so wonderful. I opened with the butternut squash soup with crab chunks and pumpkin seeds. It was ok; a bit of salt would have brought out the flavors that I felt were present but dull. Next, I tried the grilled octopus. It was solid. My main was the squid ink pasta with gulf shrimp. It was 10/10. So delicious! I closed with the bread pudding which was a lovely sweet ending. I enjoyed two rounds of their drink called "the charade." I look forward to returning to explore more the food and drink menu as well as experience the ambiance with the sun is up.

Standard upscale American fare with a nice atrium like ambience for their dining room. Food was tasty, portions average on size and service was good. We ordered a number of different entrees to share across our party. Biggest downside is that you have to order all of your food at the same time. In other words, you canâ€™t order starters first and then your main later. Perhaps this helps drive customers through the restaurant faster but feels a little inflexible to me.

Very nice spot for brunch. Overly priced drinks. Food was expensive (compared to other surrounding options) but it was very tasty.

All the staff was friendly and the huge space in the main dining room allows for a pleasantly quiet dining experience for all guests. You donâ€™t have to shout over any otherwise loud tables.

I wish they had been brunch drink options but the food is delicious.

Arriving for brunch, we were greeted by a soothing ambiance. The venue exuded a pleasing aesthetic. The chilaquiles proved to be delicious, while the eggs Norwegian was average. Overall, a favorable spot for a laid-back and peaceful brunch outing.

Ambiente pulito e molto bello. Personale gentile e veloce nel servizio. Cibo di buona qualitÃ , cucinati bene e presentato in modo adeguato.
Un appunto Ã¨ relativo alla temperatura del locale, troppo freddo. A mio parere, avrebbero dovuto, ad un certo punto della serata, alzare la temperatura.
Ãˆ un locale dove andare per trascorrere una serata gradevole mangiando del buon cibo. Prezzi adeguati
Da consigliare

Absolutely gorgeous place, truly impressive and quite sprawling for the city. Came before a concert at The Beacon theater with a friend on a Saturday night. Got the heart romance Caesar salad, hamachi crudo, and I got the squid ink linguineâ€¦

Bellissima location situata vicino a Central Park. Personale fantastico, cibo guatoso e ottimi cocktail. Abbiamo ordinato una burrata salad come antipasto e il salmone come piatto principale. Davvero squisiti. Locale molto intimo e con luci soffuse per passare una bellissima serata romantica.

The Milling Room is a very nice neighborhood tavern with an open, spacious and airy dining room. Greeted with a smile and mostly those who attended us were friendly and professional. Unfortunately, the food, depending what you order is hit or miss. We were there for a late brunch, wasn't very crowded and ordered the short rib hash and cheese burger. Mixed verdict on the food....the short rib hash was bland and meh at best as so were the fries, while those in our party who ordered the burger said it was very good. Reasonably priced for the UWS, but doubt would try again or recommend with so many great neighborhood restaurants in the city. Perhaps the other dishes or night menu are better? I wish them well.

Was really surprised by the atmosphere, awesome venue , really opens up in the back.  Great drinks, loved the ice cube - actually let it melt and drank some of the spicy mix in itâ€¦.  The food was raved about by all guests, I couldnâ€™t eat seafood so I was quite limited but I had the steak and it was solid.

The brunch is superb! They carry a very good selection of savory and sweet fair in the menu,  the steak and eggs is really good and the service is great, the only thing is that the bloody Marys are way too small!

Comfortable ambiance and tolerable noise level made for a pleasant dinner experience. Plenty of seats during early dinner hours allowed space between tables. The service and food are both excellent. Waitress was attentive and gave good suggestions, including the short rib, which was delicious. The chilled pea soup was light and flavorful, great for summertime dining. Thoroughly enjoyed the meal.

I had the pleasure of photographing Hanna and Danâ€™s beautiful fall wedding at The Milling Room, and I canâ€™t recommend it enough! This spacious and bright restaurant was the perfect setting for their special day. The oversized skylight provided stunning natural light, creating a magical atmosphere for their I doâ€™s. Despite it being November, the thoughtful design of the space made every photo look so bright and vibrant. Itâ€™s truly a hidden gem for weddings! ig @konradbrattke

The million room is quintessential upper west side with amazing food and even better drinks. The menu tends to be seasonal and is always a hit. Iâ€™m not too much of a dessert guy but they do it right! The bar is great before dinner and the main dining space is unbeatable. 15 out of 10 highly recommend

We made our way to the UWS from NJ for this restaurant week prix-fixe menu. The Milling Room has plentiful availability, offered a warm welcome, our choice of seating in a large and well lit dining room. The limited restaurant week menu has enough variety for everyone's taste. Our server was courteous and attentive. Wines and cocktails by the glass were reasonable (they also offered a by the bottle special). Food was well prepared, presented and flavorful. A nice all around experience.

We had a very nice dinner on Sun there. The deco and the space is gorgeous, the skylight is beautiful, and the high ceiling gives it a very open feel. We started with chilled corn soup with lump crabmeat, and cauliflower with baby beets as appetizer, both are delicious and refreshing. We then had linguine alla carbonara pasta, and ricotta gnocchi as mid course, both were well seasoned and nicely plated. For entrees, we had the free range roasted chicken, and dry aged NY strip, they were spectacular, and the brussels sprouts side dish was very good too. Dessert was sticky toffee pudding, and sorbet with fresh berries. The wine pairing throughout dinner was spot on by Melissa ( GM ). It was a really wonderful dining experience, highly recommended.

Went here with a group of 6 and really enjoyed. The octopus and pastas were the standouts. We all ordered the steak, and thought it was just fine. Nice that it comes with mashed potatoes. Decent value and very cool atmosphere.

Had a lovely dinner at The Milling Room. Itâ€™s a beautiful space with very nice ambiance and history (previously the Endicott Hotel).

For appetizers we had the grilled octopus and the market salad. Both were delicious. The octopus was so tender and the sauces were very flavorful and balanced. The salad was simple but perfect.

For entrees I had the roasted chicken and my husband had the squid ink pasta. The chicken wasâ€¦ next level. Iâ€™ve never had such a juicy chicken breast before. The skin was so crispy and delicious. The potato purÃ©e was perfectly smooth and velvety, and the leek fondue was so fresh.

The squid ink pasta was incredible. It was one of those dishes where you take your first bite then your eyes go wide. It was a perfect pasta dish - garlicky and also had calabrian chili oil for a little kick.

For dessert we had cappuccinos and the berry vacherin. It was fresh and light, exactly how I wanted to end the meal. The pistachio crÃ¨me brÃ»lÃ©e and the banana sticky toffee pudding sounded amazing too. Iâ€™ll need to save more room for dessert next time!

Lastly, staff were all highly professional and prompt, from the hostess to the server to the busser. I also noticed there was a sommelier so Iâ€™m sure they take their wine list seriously. We will definitely be back with friends and family in tow!

We got married at The Milling Room on 11/13/221. I debated not writing this review because I want to keep how amazing this space is a secret for just me. We were looking for a venue that was big enough for 90-100 people but still small and intimate, a place that could fit a dance floor but didn't feel huge, rustic but chic, and The Milling Room fits all of this. Hannah is badass- she was on top of everything the night of the wedding, throughout COVID changes, and throughout the 1.5 years leading up to our wedding day for everything else. The space barely needs any additional decoration because it's already decorated so perfectly as is. We had our ceremony right in the space at the fireplace/mantle. If you've been here for brunch or dinner, you know the cocktails, food, and dessert are already slamming, the bar itself is gorgeous. All we needed to do was add some candles and "moody fall" flowers as the chef's kiss for our wedding. And on top of all of this, it's affordable. We feel so lucky to have gotten married here.

Good food - the steak and beetroot salad were pretty good. The interior is a wonderful sight, probably better to go in the daytime where there's sunlight because at night it was pretty dim.  The restaurant extends pretty deep with a bar near the entrance. Pleasant meal, walked away satisfied.

I went there with my team for our year end dinner. We booked an entire room. The dinner contained cocktails, maincourse followed by dessert. We had a great time, and also made some noise, as we were playing games. The staff was nice about it.

The Milling Room is such a lovely restaurant in UWS. I love the beautiful, open, spacious dining area.

I came for brunch with a friend and we had a very comfortable dining experience, with their large tables spaced out nicely and high ceilings. At many other restaurants in the city, tables are right next to each other, so we really liked how the tables were spread out and we could enjoy a conversation without having to yell over other voices.

I ordered the Creamy Risotto ($21+), with asparagus, English peas, fava beans and parmigiano. It had a poached egg on top, which was nice. The dish itself was a bit bland, though. I would recommend asking for extra parmesan.

I would love to make this one of my go-to brunch spots, but will need to find a dish I really like.

Stunningly beautiful and very creative space and ambiance. Our waiter Moses was very helpful and charming. We loved the shrimp appetizer and lava cake desert. Excellent cocktails too. Definitely recommended.

All-around amazing restaurant find in Upper West Side. Delicious and focused food menu. Range of cocktails, beer, and wine list with great bartender recommendations. Spacious and trendy atmosphere. Friendly and attentive wait staffâ€¦

Extremely average. I paid like over 50 dollars for the wagyu steak and you expect it to feel worth it, but it wasnâ€™t. I was excited for the salad and it was just disappointing. My dad had a pasta dish and it was fine, not good. We went during the week day so it was pretty empty, but itâ€™s a big restaurant so there was actually a lot of people. It felt empty tho. Itâ€™s good for what it is, but I didnâ€™t walk away feeling like that was a great meal.

My family and I loved this restaurant. The staff is very friendly and professional and we apreciated the quality of the fresh ingredients of the meals. We order a soup, shrimp salad and flat iron steak and everything was very tasty.

Excellent experience and atmosphere. Friendly staff and knowledgeable server, I'm sorry I don't remember his name but he was great. Drinks were delicious the food as you can see was amazing. Thank you all. We had salmon tartare, Burrata, black bass and the salmon.
We came for brunch and I can recommend the Duck & Veggie hash options - very filling and really tasty. Very attentive with the water - the team were friendly and welcoming; I enjoyed our visit.

I have been here several times, but the most recent time was for my 30th birthday celebration. They let me friends set up balloons and decorations early, which was so nice. Our server was kind and funny and let us be silly all night long,â€¦
